title: 111_hr4943
content: The Act titled "Informed Taxpayers' Federal Government Annual Reporting Act of 2010" requires annual federal government financial information to be included in Form 1040 instructions. The Secretary of the Treasury must prepare an annual report for each fiscal year to be included in tax return instructions. The report will include divisions titled "Current Federal Government Finances," "Federal Government Finances & You," and "Projected Federal Government." The annual report prepared by the Secretary of the Treasury includes a section on "Current Federal Government Finances," detailing revenues, outlays, budget deficit or surplus, and gross Federal debt for the fiscal year and preceding year. It also compares the budget deficit or surplus between the current and previous fiscal years. The summary described in this paragraph includes information on income tax filers, total gross Federal debt, and the difference in debt between the current and previous fiscal year. The summary includes estimates of federal government finances for the succeeding fiscal year and the next 10 fiscal years, including revenues, outlays, deficits or surpluses, and total gross Federal debt. The report required under this section shall be based on cbo estimates from the Congressional Budget Office and written in a manner understandable by the average person. The report must prominently display instructions for tax returns on the IRS website and in published materials.
